conclusion: The graph shows velocity as a function of time.
The graph is symmetric about the vertical dashed line.
The graph starts at a positive velocity, decreases to zero, then increases back to a positive velocity.
At t = 0, the particle has a positive velocity.
At some point between 0 and t1, the velocity reaches zero.
After reaching zero, the velocity becomes negative and then positive again.
The motion from 0 to the point where the velocity is zero is mirrored from the point where the velocity is zero to t1.
The particle starts at a certain position with a positive velocity.
The particle reaches a maximum distance from the starting point when the velocity is zero.
After the velocity becomes negative, the particle moves backward towards the starting point.
The particle will pass through the same position three times due to symmetry.
The particle starts at a certain position, moves forward to a maximum distance, reverses direction, and returns to the starting position.
The final answer is that the particle passes through the same position three times.
